p: IgY includes the majority of immunoglobulins that are found in chicken eggs (~100 mg/yolk). Although IgY is structurally different from IgG, it is homologous to the IgG of mammals and plays a similar role [ 27] . In addition, the use of chickens as a host for antibody production provides antibodies in a non-invasive way, is sustainable, and requires fewer immunization doses over an extended period of time [ 28].
